direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods manipulate the class attribute of an element, but in opposite ways (adding vs. removing).
Both methods modify the class attribute, but toggleClass adds or removes based on the current state.
addClass relies on the attr method to set the class attribute, indicating a dependency.
addClass uses the classNames method to manage the set of class names, indicating a dependency.
Both methods deal with class names, but hasClass checks for the presence of a class.
addClass indirectly uses the className method to get the current class attribute value.
addClass uses the classNames method to retrieve the current set of class names.
Both methods involve string manipulation and validation, though they operate on different types of data (class names vs. URLs).
Both methods encode data, but implemented in different external libraries.
Both methods handle data conversion with similar control flows and exception handling.
